item.title: ::ipban (user) is failing, why?
item.dc:creator: @lewis2 lewis`
item.description:
@lewis2 wrote:

hey guy this is my ipban,

[code] if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“0wner v0id”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully fucked");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS Ip-Banned " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");[/code]

and it will just make me lost connection and log back in, there is some kind of problem with this? or is it something to do with my user?

any help appreciated.

lewis`.
